title: Fort Point National Historic Site: Safety
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Safety            Your Safety        Welcome to Fort Point National Historic Site. We hope your visit is enjoyable, enlightening, fun and safe. Here are several things to consider when visiting. Fort Point is located in a busy, urban environment. The entry road or promenade along the water's edge is a very active area. Enjoy the spectacular views, but be on the lookout for fast-moving bicycles, runners, walkers, dog walkers, baby strollers, skateboards, uneven pavement and pounding waves. Dial 911 in Emergencies Call to report accidents, fires, or life-threatening emergencies. Cell phone coverage exists throughout most of Fort Point.  Handrail Safety   Please always use handrails that are provided. Steps can be slippery due to weather conditions and moisture. Vehicle Safety Please do not leave visible items in your vehicle, regardless of where you are parking. We are not responsible for lost or stolen items. Awareness Please report any suspicious activities to the visitor center.
